title: Hey riot, Do you plan on giving Kassadin another skin? I mean, It has been 4 years since Harbinger
body: There is quite a lot of possible concepts like : Blademaster (would be fancy), Arclight... Anything ! Please riot tell me you haven't forgotten him !

replies.body:
Kassadin has not been forgotten!

Sorry that's all I can say for now - but I just had to let you know that he is not on the off-limits list and that the skins team are keen to get another skin for him out the door.
Just take care not to give him a 750 RP skin or you might find the Kassadin playerbase staring void daggers at your back every chance they get.
We call that 'Ezreal Syndrome' T_T

Honestly, I rarely take issues with Riot's choice of skin recipients, most of the skins are awesome!
...but I was definitely more than a little bit miffed when Ezreal got a 750 RP skin recently. (Not because he got yet another skin, but because I play him and really want more than one skin with VFX changes).

Giving Ezreal two 750 RP skins in a row was definitely our mistake. At the time we were looking for an ADC that would fit into the slot and he made a lot of sense, but going forward with 750s we will do our best to make sure they are more appropriate for each champion and the player expectations before trying to round out a conventional team comp.

We do mess up and when we do we really feel it; I'm not the only one that trawls boards/reddit/S@20 for every bit of feedback. When we disappoint players, that includes a lot of Rioters too! It feels to me that we owe it to players to ensure the next Ezreal skin has some really cool particles.

It takes a lot of courage to own up to mistakes, you have my respect for that.

Honestly, the main thing to look out for on potential 750 RP skins (from the community perspective) are if:
a) The Champion is lacking on new particle skins (i.e. MF - has a ton of skins, she only has one that changes particles though, so a 975+ RP skin is probably preferred)
b) The Champion is lacking on skins (i.e. Zed - Mass disappointment if a champion that hasn't gotten a skin in a long time gets a 750 RP skin)

Thanks for the feedback, I totally agree. In fact we discussed this exact thing as a team this morning. Queen of Diamonds Syndra was another skin that made us realise that we really need to make sure the design of 750s support the base particles. Prehistoric Anivia was me trying to solve this issue on a particle heavy champion.

Sometimes champions that haven't had a skin for a while will get a 750 though. Our theory here is that if they otherwise would not have gotten a skin at all in the foreseeable future then this, while potentially disappointing for some, is still the better option. RiotPenguin's choice of Mordekaiser for the King of Clubs is an example of this.

During my interview, when they asked me if I had any questions, I said 'Taric skin where?' and 'When is Lux getting a good skin?'. In a similar vein to this, I'm still wondering what the thought process behind making Blood Moon Zilean was.  It certainly does _not feel_ like a skin that was:

1. Worth the four year wait (especially at 975 RP)
2. Fitting with a "time lord" concept.  ("Moon" barely relates to time, and especially NOT in this instance)
3. All that interesting compared to other ideas floating around (A Dr. Who)

It honestly feels like the skins team, supposedly some of the best artists and modelers in the video game industry, said "let's make a Zilean skin," brainstormed for 10 short minutes, and just chose the best idea out of a pile of very half-assed ideas instead of taking the time to develop a truly awesome concept that would fit a broken rig.

Seriously, that skin feels like a chroma / palette swap with some red effects and a recycled mask.
